meanings.definition: To add excessive decoration or ornamentation to something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overembellish her drawings with too many colors and sparkles.
meanings.sent2: He always overembellishes his stories, making them sound more exciting than they really are.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so overembellished with frosting that it looked more like a piece of art than a dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like an overembellished painting, full of unnecessary details and flourishes.
meanings.sent5: The garden was overembellished with so many flowers that it became overwhelming to look at.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate or elaborate on something beyond what is necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overembellish his achievements, making them seem more impressive than they really are.
meanings.sent2: She always overembellishes her excuses, trying to make them sound more believable.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's tale was so overembellished that it was hard to separate fact from fiction.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, overembellishing the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The storm overembellished the landscape, turning it into a scene from a dramatic movie.
